import React, { Component } from 'react'; import { Link } from 'react-router-dom'; class Lesson_2 extends Component { render() { return (
Chapter 3: State Variables & Integers

Great Job! Let's formally start our Smart Contract

Vyper is a statically typed language, which means that the type of each variable (state and local) needs to be specified or at least known at compile-time.

State variables are values which are permanently stored in contract storage. This means they're written to the Ethereum blockchain.

#This will be stored permanently in the blockchain

mySignedInteger: int128

myUnsignedInteger: uint256

In this example contract, we created a int128 called mySignedInteger and a uint256 called myUnsignedInteger.



Signed Integers: int128

A signed integer (128 bit) is a type to store positive and negative integers.



Unsigned Integers: int256

A unsigned integer (256 bit) is a type to store non-negative integers.



Let's test it

Our Viper DNA will be determing using a 16-digit number.

Declare a uint256 integer and name it viperDNADigits.

  • chevron_left
  • 3
  • chevron_right
) } } export default Lesson_2;
